description: A square temple located c. 200 yards north west of Lancing Ring. Martyn et al suggest that the temple is very likely late Iron Age in date but was probably out of use by the late 3rd CE or early 4th CE.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, et al, (2015), Lancing Down (East Sussex), available at: https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449
Rudling, D., (2008), Roman-Period Temples, Shrines and Religion in Sussex, in Ritual Landscapes of Roman South-East Britain
Bedwin, O., (1981), Excavations at Lancing Down, West Sussex, 1980, Sussex Archaeological Collections, 119, pg. 37 - 56
Frere, S., (1940), Sussex Archaeological Collections, 81, pg. 145 ff
(1935), Sussex, in Victoria County History, 3, pg. 59
Smith, C., (1848), Collectanea Antiqua, 1, pg. 92 ff
